p: Extensive reports have been conducted on the anti-HBV effects of natural products. A polyphenol, isochlorogenic acid ( Hao et al., 2012), dehydrocheilanthifoline and some other amide alkaloids have been reported to show anti-HBV effects ( Jiang et al., 2013; Zeng et al., 2013). Curcumin, as a polyphenol, down-regulated the coactivator of HBV transcription, peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-gamma coactivator 1-α (PGC-1α), and thereby inhibited HBV gene replication and expression ( Rechtman et al., 2010).
